metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1283 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: Multiple integer overflows in the XML_GetBuffer function in Expat through 2.1.0, as used in Google Chrome before 44.0.2403.89 and other products, allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted XML data, a related issue to CVE-2015-2716. USN-2726-1 addressed CVE-2015-1283 for Expat. This update provides the corresponding fix for VNC4 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM.

criterions.comment: cadaver package in hirsute is affected and needs fixing.
chromium-browser package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195').
coin3 package in hirsute is affected and needs fixing.
expat package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-7').
matanza package in hirsute is affected and needs fixing.
swish-e package in hirsute is affected and needs fixing.
xmlrpc-c package in hirsute is affected and needs fixing.
